text: there are a lot of veggie burger recipes
out there but I've never found one with
the same satisfying texture as a
hamburger until I made one up it takes a
lot of ingredients to make a good veggie
burger but each one adds something
either in terms of flavor or texture
part of the problem with so many of
veggie burgers that they tend to be
mushy and what contributes to the
Machinist is moisture content so what
I've done here is I've roasted a lot of
the ingredients that I'm using and
roasting intensifies flavor but it also
drives off moisture so it gives you a
more compact texturally pleasing burger
I've roasted my mushrooms I also have
roasted some tofu and as you can see
they've gotten caramelized and they've
also dried out a little bit which is
what you want and I've done the same
thing over here to kidney beans and I've
also added some grated beet it adds a
little bit of sweetness and it gives it
a really nice read sort of beefy color
first I'm gonna do is grind up some nuts
you can use any nuts but if you find
tamari almonds they're so great because
the tamari has that umami flavor it has
that sort of extra savoriness that you
find in beef but not necessarily in all
vegetables Brian Musa and you just want
them coarsely ground you don't want them
to turn to butter I'm gonna add all my
cold veggies it might seem like a pain
roasting all of these ingredients ahead
of time but the thing is you can do it
all together you put both pans in the
oven at the same time and I'm just going
to add almost everything else of course
salt lots of garlic smoked paprika to
give it that smoky flavor even though
we're also going to get smoke from the
grill may seem odd but mayonnaise
increases the succulence eggs holds it
all together
cheese YUM scallion
and this is a Japanese breadcrumbs so
you don't want to over process this
you're looking for a kind of chunky
texture if you overprocess you're going
to get a uniform texture and then it's
going to be more like a pancake and not
very burger ease so maybe just a little
bit finer than this because you can
still sort of see whole beans that is
good that is looking good
this is tempeh it's the most meaty
textured thing that goes in here and
brown rice also great for texture I'm
just going to give it one or two pulses
yeah that's plenty now I'm gonna make
this into burgers it could stick them in
your fridge for a couple of hours or
individually wrap them and stick them in
your freezer you want to grill these
while they're still cold that way they
really stay together I'm gonna cover the
grill that way they'll cook evenly since
they are veggie burgers you do not have
to worry about making them rare you want
them perfectly cooked Oh 4 to 6 minutes
per side so you just want to check on
these every once in a while and if they
do start to look a little brown all you
have to do is just push them to the
sides of the grill and then you finish
them over indirect heat these are
looking like they are done if you like
your buns grilled now is the time to
grill them up I like them grilled I'm
gonna build this up exactly like I would
a regular hamburger a lot of mustard you
can use pickles onion I'm going to use
pickled jalapeno you make a veggie
burger because you want the burger
experience without the meat this one
delivers
Oh
